intro: Drepanocarpus polyphyllus, commonly known as the many-leaved hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
